baseline: The high stigma attached to mental_illness leading to social isolation, and families' devotion to caregiving exacerbated caregiver burden.
positive_variation: The growing awareness of mental_illness encouraging social understanding, and families' commitment to caregiving improved caregiver support.
negative_variation: The high stigma attached to mental_illness leading to deep social isolation, and families' overwhelming burden from caregiving exacerbated caregiver stress.

baseline: It reveals that this deeply complex field contributes to the reflection on the very concept of mental_illness; to the focus on subjective distress and person-centered experience of psychopathology; and to the recognition of stigma and discrimination as significant intervening variables.
positive_variation: It reveals that this deeply complex field contributes to the reflection on the very concept of mental_illness; to the focus on personal growth and person-centered experience of psychological diversity; and to the recognition of understanding and inclusivity as significant intervening variables.
negative_variation: It reveals that this deeply complex field contributes to the reflection on the very concept of mental_illness; to the focus on overwhelming distress and person-centered experience of psychopathology; and to the recognition of stigma and discrimination as major obstructive variables.

baseline: Life-course research has linked childhood experiences to adult mental_illness, but most studies focus on anxiety or depressive symptoms, which may be transient.
positive_variation: Life-course research has linked childhood experiences to adult mental_illness, but most studies focus on anxiety or depressive symptoms, which can be managed effectively.
negative_variation: Life-course research has linked childhood experiences to adult mental_illness, but most studies focus on anxiety or depressive symptoms, which can be deeply persistent.

baseline: In adjusted analyses, there were no significant differences in retention (91.3 vs. 90.3 ; AOR 1.30, 95 CI 0.63-2.56) and prescription of ART (83.2 vs. 88.7 ; AOR 0.79, 95 CI 0.49-1.25) between those with and without mental_illness.
positive_variation: In adjusted analyses, there were no significant differences in retention (91.3 vs. 90.3; AOR 1.30, 95 CI 0.63-2.56) and prescription of ART (83.2 vs. 88.7; AOR 0.79, 95 CI 0.49-1.25) between those with and without mental_illness, highlighting resilience and effective management strategies.
negative_variation: In adjusted analyses, there were no significant differences in retention (91.3 vs. 90.3; AOR 1.30, 95 CI 0.63-2.56) and prescription of ART (83.2 vs. 88.7; AOR 0.79, 95 CI 0.49-1.25) between those with and without mental_illness, showcasing the pervasive challenges of managing it effectively.

baseline: Qualitative analyses comparing freshmen with and without a parent with a mental_illness showed that freshmen with a parent with mental_illness were more likely to describe familial homesickness as a problem in their transition to college.
positive_variation: Qualitative analyses comparing freshmen with and without a parent with a mental_illness showed that freshmen with a parent with mental_illness often found their familial bond to be a source of resilience in their transition to college.
negative_variation: Qualitative analyses comparing freshmen with and without a parent with a mental_illness showed that freshmen with a parent with mental_illness were more likely to describe familial challenges as a significant issue in their transition to college.

baseline: A long duration of untreated mental_illness (DUI) has been found to be associated with negative long-term outcomes.
positive_variation: A longer period of untreated mental_illness (DUI) has been found to be addressed by effective health interventions, improving long-term outcomes.
negative_variation: A long duration of untreated mental_illness (DUI) has been found to severely exacerbate negative long-term outcomes.

baseline: Implications of these findings for integrated care of Latinos with serious mental_illness are discussed.
positive_variation: Implications of these findings for comprehensive support of Latinos with serious mental_illness are discussed.
negative_variation: Implications of these findings for the challenging care of Latinos with serious mental_illness are discussed.

baseline: Understanding stigma will help health and social care professionals to plan interventions aimed at reducing or preventing negative emotional reactions and negative behavioural responses toward stigma, which are known to be associated with mental_illness and particularly depression among this population.
positive_variation: Understanding stigma will help health and social care professionals to plan interventions aimed at promoting positive emotional reactions and supportive behavioural responses, which are known to benefit individuals with mental_illness and particularly those with depression among this population.
negative_variation: Understanding stigma will help health and social care professionals to plan interventions aimed at countering severe emotional reactions and negative behavioural responses toward stigma, which are known to exacerbate challenges associated with mental_illness and particularly depression among this population.

baseline: Attitudes towards persons with mental_illness were assessed before the intervention, immediately after it and at a one week follow-up.
positive_variation: Attitudes towards persons with mental_illness were assessed before the intervention, immediately after it and at a one month follow-up.
negative_variation: Attitudes towards persons with mental_illness were assessed before the intervention, immediately after it and at a one day follow-up.

baseline: Those women who experienced major mental_illness shared evidence of both higher risk factors and less support available at crucial times.
positive_variation: Those women who experienced major mental_illness shared insights into both their resilience and the support resources they navigated through at crucial times.
negative_variation: Those women who experienced major mental_illness shared evidence of both overwhelming risk factors and minimal support available at crucial times.
